name: terminusdb-client
summary: TerminusDB client library for accessing the Terminus DB API

memberVariables.name: server_url
memberVariables.summary: URL of the server that this client connected.

memberVariables.name: team
memberVariables.summary: Team that this client is using. "admin" for local dbs.

memberVariables.name: db
memberVariables.summary: Database that this client is connected to.

memberVariables.name: user
memberVariables.summary: TerminiusDB user that this client is using. "admin" for local dbs.

memberVariables.name: branch
memberVariables.summary: Branch of the database that this client is connected to. Default to "main".

memberVariables.name: ref
memberVariables.summary: Ref setting for the client. Default to None.

memberVariables.name: repo
memberVariables.summary: Repo identifier of the database that this client is connected to. Default to "local".

memberFunctions.name: __init__

parameters.name: server_url
parameters.summary: URL of the server that this client will connect to.

parameters.name: user_agent
parameters.summary: User agent header when making requests. Defaults to terminusdb-client-python with the version appended.

parameters.name: **kwargs
parameters.summary: Extra configuration options

memberFunctions.summary: The Client constructor.

memberFunctions.name: connect

parameters.name: team
parameters.summary: Name of the team, default to be "admin"

parameters.name: db
parameters.summary: Name of the database connected

parameters.name: remote_auth
parameters.summary: Remote Auth setting

parameters.name: key
parameters.summary: API key for connecting, default to be "root"

parameters.name: user
parameters.summary: Name of the user, default to be "admin"

parameters.name: use_token
parameters.summary: Use token to connect. If both `jwt_token` and `api_token` is not provided (None), then it will use the ENV variable TERMINUSDB_ACCESS_TOKEN to connect as the API token

parameters.name: jwt_token
parameters.summary: The Bearer JWT token to connect. Default to be None.

parameters.name: api_token
parameters.summary: The API token to connect. Default to be None.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.summary: Branch to be connected, default to be "main"

parameters.name: ref
parameters.summary: Ref setting

parameters.name: repo
parameters.summary: Local or remote repo, default to be "local"

parameters.name: **kwargs
parameters.summary: Extra configuration options.

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363")
>>> client.connect(key="root", team="admin", user="admin", db="example_db")
memberFunctions.summary: Connect to a Terminus server at the given URI with an API key.

memberFunctions.name: close
memberFunctions.summary: Undo connect and close the connection.

memberFunctions.name: _check_connection
memberFunctions.summary:
Raise connection InterfaceError if not connected
Defaults to check if a db is connected

memberFunctions.name: info
memberFunctions.summary: Get info of a TerminusDB database server

memberFunctions.name: ok
memberFunctions.summary:
Check whether the TerminusDB server is still OK.
   Status is not OK when this function returns false
   or throws an exception (mostly ConnectTimeout)

memberFunctions.name: log

returns.summary:
List of the following commit objects:
```
  {
   "@id":"InitialCommit/hpl18q42dbnab4vzq8me4bg1xn8p2a0",
   "@type":"InitialCommit",
   "author":"system",
   "identifier":"hpl18q42dbnab4vzq8me4bg1xn8p2a0",
   "message":"create initial schema",
   "schema":"layer_data:Layer_4234adfe377fa9563a17ad764ac37f5dcb14de13668ea725ef0748248229a91b",
   "timestamp":1660919664.9129035
  }
```

memberFunctions.summary:
Get commit history of a database
Parameters
----------
team : str, optional
     The team from which the database is. Defaults to the class property.
db : str, optional
     The database. Defaults to the class property.
start : int, optional
     Commit index to start from. Defaults to 0.
count : int, optional
     Amount of commits to get. Defaults to -1 which gets all.

memberFunctions.name: get_commit_history

parameters.name: max_history
parameters.summary: maximum number of commit that would return, counting backwards from your current commit. Default is set to 500. It needs to be nop-negative, if input is 0 it will still give the last commit.

memberFunctions.summary:
Get the whole commit history.
Commit history - Commit id, author of the commit, commit message and the commit time, in the current branch from the current commit, ordered backwards in time, will be returned in a dictionary in the follow format:
```
{ "commit_id":
     { "author": "commit_author",
       "message": "commit_message",
       "timestamp: <datetime object of the timestamp>"
     }
}
```

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> clone = client.copy()
>>> assert client is not clone
memberFunctions.summary: Create a deep copy of this client.

parameters.summary: the source branch for the rebase

memberFunctions.name: reset

parameters.name: commit
parameters.summary: Commit id or path to the commit (if use_path is True), for instance '234980523ffaf93' or 'admin/database/local/commit/234980523ffaf93'. If not provided, it will reset to the newest commit (useful when need to go back after a soft reset).

parameters.name: soft
parameters.summary: Flag indicating if the reset if soft, that is referencing to a previous commit instead of resetting to a previous commit in the backend and wipping newer commits.

parameters.name: use_path
parameters.summary: Wheather or not the commit given is an id or path. Default using id and use_path is False.

memberFunctions.summary: Reset the current branch HEAD to the specified commit path. If `soft` is not True, it will be a hard reset, meaning reset to that commit in the backend and newer commit will be wipped out. If `soft` is True, the client will only reference to that commit and can be reset to the newest commit when done.

memberFunctions.name: optimize

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: Path to optimize, for instance admin/database/_meta for the repo graph.

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> client.optimize('admin/database') # optimise database branch (here main)
>>> client.optimize('admin/database/_meta') # optimise the repository graph (actually creates a squashed flat layer)
>>> client.optimize('admin/database/local/_commits') # commit graph is optimised
memberFunctions.summary: Optimize the specified path.

memberFunctions.name: squash

parameters.name: message
parameters.summary: Message for the newly created squash commit

parameters.name: author
parameters.summary: Author of the commit

parameters.name: reset
parameters.summary: Perform reset after squash

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> client.connect(user="admin", key="root", team="admin", db="some_db")
>>> client.squash('This is a squash commit message!')
memberFunctions.summary: Squash the current branch HEAD into a commit

memberFunctions.name: apply

parameters.name: before_version
parameters.summary: Before branch/commit to compare

parameters.name: after_object
parameters.summary: After branch/commit to compare

parameters.name: branch
parameters.summary: Branch to apply to. Optional.

memberFunctions.summary: Diff two different commits and apply changes on branch

memberFunctions.name: diff_object

parameters.name: before_object
parameters.summary: Before object to compare

parameters.name: after_object
parameters.summary: After object to compare

memberFunctions.summary: Diff two different objects.

memberFunctions.name: diff_version

parameters.name: before_version
parameters.summary: Commit or branch of the before version to compare

parameters.name: after_version
parameters.summary: Commit or branch of the after version to compare

memberFunctions.summary: Diff two different versions. Can either be a branch or a commit

memberFunctions.name: diff
examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> client.connect(user="admin", key="root", team="admin", db="some_db")
>>> result = client.diff({ "@id" : "Person/Jane", "@type" : "Person", "name" : "Jane"}, { "@id" : "Person/Jane", "@type" : "Person", "name" : "Janine"})
>>> result.to_json = '{ "name" : { "@op" : "SwapValue", "@before" : "Jane", "@after": "Janine" }}'
memberFunctions.summary: DEPRECATED

memberFunctions.name: patch

parameters.name: before
parameters.summary: Object before to patch

parameters.name: patch
parameters.summary: Patch object to apply to the dict

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> client.connect(user="admin", key="root", team="admin", db="some_db")
>>> patch_obj = Patch(json='{"name" : { "@op" : "ValueSwap", "@before" : "Jane", "@after": "Janine" }}')
>>> result = client.patch({ "@id" : "Person/Jane", "@type" : Person", "name" : "Jane"}, patch_obj)
>>> print(result)
'{ "@id" : "Person/Jane", "@type" : Person", "name" : "Janine"}'
memberFunctions.summary: Apply the patch object to the before object and return an after object. Note that this change does not commit changes to the graph.

memberFunctions.name: patch_resource
examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363/")
>>> client.connect(user="admin", key="root", team="admin", db="some_db")
>>> patch_obj = Patch(json='{"name" : { "@op" : "ValueSwap", "@before" : "Jane", "@after": "Janine" }}')
>>> result = client.patch_resource(patch_obj,branch="main")
>>> print(result)
'["Person/Jane"]'
memberFunctions.summary: Apply the patch object to the given resource

memberFunctions.name: change_capabilities

parameters.name: capability_change
parameters.summary:
Dict for the capability change request.

Example:
{
 "operation": "revoke",
 "scope": "UserDatabase/f5a0ef94469b32e1aee321678436c7dfd5a96d9c476672b3282ae89a45b5200e",
 "user": "User/admin",
 "roles": [
     "Role/consumer",
     "Role/admin"
  ]
}

returns.type: dict or None if request failed

memberFunctions.summary: Change the capabilities of a certain user

memberFunctions.name: add_role

parameters.name: role
parameters.summary: The role dict

examples:
>>> client = Client("http://127.0.0.1:6363")
>>> client.connect(key="root", team="admin", user="admin", db="example_db")
>>> role = {
    "name": "Grand Pubah",
    "action": [
        "branch",
        "class_frame",
        "clone",
        "commit_read_access",
        "commit_write_access",
        "create_database",
        "delete_database",
        "fetch",
        "instance_read_access",
        "instance_write_access",
        "manage_capabilities",
        "meta_read_access",
        "meta_write_access",
        "push",
        "rebase",
        "schema_read_access",
        "schema_write_access"
      ]
  }
>>> client.add_role(role)
memberFunctions.summary: Add a new role
